item.title: India fences almost 80pc with Bangladesh
item.description: India has fenced almost 80 per cent of its border with Bangladesh, according to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). According to data provided by the Ministry of Home Affairs, India has physically fenced nearly 79 per cent of the length of the India-Bangladesh border, and over 93 per cent of the I

item.title: Tarique calls himself ‘half-Sylheti’
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman has described himself as “half-Sylheti” while speaking at a discussion meeting on Great Victory Day at the City Pavilion in London. “Many of you here are not just from Sylhet, but from other districts as well. Yet most of you are Sylhetis,&rdquo

item.title: EC urges TV channels to avoid 'insults, personal attacks' in talk shows
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has asked television channels to refrain from airing insults, derogatory remarks or personal attacks in talk shows and election-related discussions ahead of the 13th national election and referendum due in February next year. In a letter sent on Wednesday to the secret

item.title: Fire breaks out at plastic warehouse in Lalbagh
item.description: A fire broke out at a plastic warehouse in the Islambagh area of Lalbagh in Old Dhaka on Wednesday afternoon. Four units of the Fire Service rushed to the scene to control the blaze. Firefighting operations were underway at the time of reporting. The cause of the fire could not be determined imme

item.title: India summons Bangladesh high commissioner
item.description: Bangladesh’s high commissioner to New Delhi, M. Riaz Hamidullah, has been summoned by India’s Ministry of External Affairs. He was called in at the ministry on Wednesday afternoon to issue a formal diplomatic protest over recent threats to the Indian High Commission in Dhaka and inflam

item.title: Tejgaon College students protest in Farmgate over death of peer Sakibul
item.description: Students of Dhaka’s Tejgaon College have launched a protest to demand the swift arrest of those accused in the death of Sakibul Hasan Rana, who died after being injured during a clash at a college hostel. They have been staging a demonstration outside the college campus in Farmgate since ear

item.title: Forged documents block Bangladesh’s overseas job prospects: Yunus
item.description: Highlighting the importance of safer, fairer and skilled migration, Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday said the submission of fake documents has emerged as a major barrier to sending people abroad, despite the huge opportunities offered by destination countries for Bangladeshis. &ldquo

item.title: Fire breaks out at plastic warehouse in Old Dhaka's Islambagh
item.description: A fire has broken out at a plastic warehouse in Old Dhaka’s Islambagh. The Fire Service said it received reports of the fire at Chairman Ghat around 1:30pm on Wednesday and initially sent six units to the scene. Three more units were later dispatched as firefighters worked to bring the fire

item.title: Pabna BNP leader shot dead
item.description: A BNP leader has been shot dead in Ishwardi upazila of Pabna. The incident took place around 10 am on Wednesday in the Kamalpur area of Lakshmikunda Union, said Ishwardi Police Station chief (OC) Md Mominuzzaman. The victim, 65-year-old Biru Molla, was the convenor of the Lakshmikunda Union unit

item.title: Walton's founding chairman SM Nazrul Islam’s 8th death anniversary today
item.description: Today marks the 8th death anniversary of SM Nazrul Islam, the founding chairman of Walton Group and a pioneer of Bangladesh’s electronics manufacturing industry. On the occasion, Milad Mahfil and special prayers are being held on Wednesday at Walton’s headquarters, corporate office, se

item.title: Govt to modernise fire safety, power systems at Bangladesh Secretariat
item.description: Nearly a year after a devastating fire ripped through the Bangladesh Secretariat, destroying vital documents, the government has decided to undertake a major modernisation project to strengthen fire safety and ensure an uninterrupted power supply at the Secretariat and other key government installa

item.title: DMP intensifies security check posts across Dhaka
item.description: The Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) has intensified its check post system at various key points across the capital to maintain law and order. The enhanced security measures came into effect from 4:00 pm today (Wednesday), BSS reports. "We have enhanced the security arrangement with se
